# meanAveragePrecisionScore(_:labels:)

**Type Method**

Computes the mean average precision.

## Declaration

```swift
static func meanAveragePrecisionScore(_ pairs: some Sequence<(classification: ClassificationDistribution<Label>, labels: Set<Label>)>, labels: Set<Label>) -> Float
```

## Parameters

- **pairs**: A sequence of classifications and true label pairs.
- **labels**: The set of labels to consider.

## Return Value

The mean average precision.

## Discussion

An average precision score summarizes the precision-recall curve for a label. The mean average precision is the mean of the average precision scores for all the classification labels.

## Computing the precision

- **meanAveragePrecisionScore(_:)**: Computes the mean average precision.
- **meanAveragePrecisionScore(classifications:groundTruth:)**: Computes the mean average precision.
- **meanAveragePrecisionScore(classifications:groundTruth:labels:)**: Computes the mean average precision.
title: meanAveragePrecisionScore(_:labels:)
